creator: orestis82@fastmail.fm
text:
Tomcat has tools.jar in its common/lib directory, and jdk 1.4.0 has tools.jar in 
its lib directory.

This creates a conflict, and may cause "The major.minor version '48.0' is too 
recent for this tool to understand." for objects included in JSP pages, so that 
the JSP do not compile.

I think that there is a difference if you install tomcat from the .zip file and 
from the .exe file. Deleting the tools.jar from the tomcat lib directory fixes 
this.

creator: medthomas@ntlworld.com
text:
Bug 20351 explains why this is so. It is essentially a workaround used to 
prevent problems users were experiencing when using the windows installer.

Removing tools.jar would re-introduce the problem. Therefore, I am resolving 
this as WONTFIX.
